answers.answer: Sorry to hear you're having such difficulty.  POTS is a possibility, but it is a difficult diagnosis to make.  If your doctor thinks you might have POTS you could undergo a tilt-table test to see how you react.  Pheochromocytoma is extremely rare and you would have symptoms of intermittent headaches, sweatiness, and you would have severe high blood pressure during these episodes.  It sounds as if your symptoms are very distressing.  You should be tested for diabetes, and you should probably get in touch with a neurologist if you haven't seen one already.  Best of luck to you!
